title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The MBTA canceled Hingham/Hull ferry service on February 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will operate from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal from 6:30 a.m. to 10:35 p.m.
Recent snowstorm caused thick ice, leading to more ferry cancellations than in past New England winters.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Daniel Kennedy, 60, a retired Gloucester Fire lieutenant, died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The accident occurred on Wilder Street at UMass Lowell last Thursday; Kennedy succumbed to his injuries at Lahey Hospital.
An investigation by the Middlesex District Attorney and Massachusetts State Police is underway to determine the cause of the crash.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas remains on the roster bubble due to recovery from a patellar tendon injury and competition at first base.
Kristian Campbell may start the season in Triple-A Worcester following last year's struggles with batting and defense.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might not make Opening Day roster due to ample depth in Red Sox rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State documents show New Hampshire officials knew about a new ICE facility proposal as early as January 12.
Plans for the Merrimack ICE detention center caused discord in Gov. Kelly Ayotte's administration, leading to a commissioner's resignation.
The Merrimack facility, with a projected capacity of 400-600 beds, is expected to cost $158 million for renovations.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell remains at left tackle for the Patriots despite struggles in the 2025 Super Bowl against the Seahawks.
Former Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle, citing his potential and recovery from an MCL injury.
Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead offers to help Campbell with offseason training to improve his skills and address performance issues.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
Vrabel encouraged players to focus on the future, emphasizing unity and continued effort following the defeat.
In his first year as head coach, Vrabel led the Patriots to 14 regular-season wins and an AFC East title.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots reassign Terrell Williams to a high-ranking position, opening defensive coordinator role for 2026 season.
Zak Kuhr, interim defensive play-caller, is favored to become full-time defensive coordinator after successful playoff run.
Terrell Williams, now cancer-free, will remain on staff in a less demanding role under Mike Vrabel's leadership.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield, dragged by a car, prosecutors report.
Incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue; police seek a dark-colored sedan and its driver.
Pittsfield police request public assistance in finding the responsible vehicle and driver.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Ann Michael Maye expressed gratitude and encouragement after Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in a quarter despite an early Seahawks lead.
Ann Michael Maye gained popularity with her 'Bakemas' videos, sharing recipes, amid the Patriots' successful season.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to benefit Boston Children's Hospital.
Gallagher's son, a patient at Boston Children's Hospital, inspired him to join the Miles for Miracles team.
The hospital's advanced neurology care has significantly helped Gallagher's son since birth, motivating the fundraising effort.
